result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared J Gardipee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs of Count 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Count 2.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Costs in Count 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in this count.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with Piggly Wiggly in Jackson.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew E Weil.  Atty Sandra J Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend Ct. 2 to Misd. Criminal Damage to Property-943.01(1), Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended.   Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended and enters judgment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; No contact with Jackson Piggly Wiggly

Def appears in custody & w/Atty  State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mandy A Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  (14CF1003 Milwaukee Co.)  State rqst $1,000.00 cash bond, counsel advises defendant able to post abouts $200.00 cash bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
